column4: If VLC gives me this error: "Please update alsa-lib to version 1.0.23-2-g8d80d5f or higher to try to fix this issue." How do I fix it?
Please update alsa-lib to version 1.0.23-2-g8d80d5f or higher to try to fix this issue. :-)
cute ;) but how do I do that?
have you done an apt-get update, upgrade lately?
yup. last night.
and what is the current version of alsa-lib?
I don't even know how to check that :-/
dpkg -l | grep -i alsa
there's no alsa-lib in that list.
probably called "libasound" or the like.
right. all those are 1.0.23-lubuntu2.1
it looks like there's an extra fix that isn't downloaded (1.0.23-2)
are you running the latest vlc, by the way?
the latest from the ubuntu repo, which is not the latest from the vlc site.
and you see this error consistently?
probably since the last update I did. I can hear sound, but only stereo.
sorry to bother you but do you happen to have any other suggestions?
i'm afraid i don't, sorry. if you're running the latest vlc and ancillary software, probably worth filing a bug report (check first to see if someone already has done)
a bug report where though? is this a vlc issue? alsa? ubuntu?
the error comes up when you run vlc, so start there.
alright, thanks for the help :)
the bug should be submitted for the vlc package under ubuntu, to be clear
the vlc maintainers will just send you back to the ubuntu folks
